runs.comm: Southee gets some swing and seam first ball. Starts to swing outside off, pitches and leaves him more. Left alone by Bell
another full outswinger and left alone again by Bell

more movement away. Left alone. That's a little stiff to call it wide. Pitched half way between the stumps and that tram line. Moved away after he had left alone. And hardly went over the tram line. Poor call
edged as he follows the movement with the hands, but plays it with soft hands and makes sure it doesn't carry to the slips
this time it moves away after angling in from wide on the crease. Left alone
more movement away from the bat and another leave. A maiden should have been over by now but for poor umpiring by Paul Reifell
wide on the crease, angling in, seeing if Bell will play at this. He won't. Lets it pass harmlessly outside off
on a length, on off, defended from the crease by Moeen
short of a length, outside off, Moeen goes back, drops this at his feet, gets a single
no swing for Boult as a length ball angles across Bell. Left alone
on the pads, clipped away off the inside half of the bat for one
there is the flying Baz. A length ball, slight swing, driven through extra cover, but then Baz rushes form mid0off and presses the propel button at the last minutes to keep them down to on
slightly short of a length, defended to leg
tucked away off the pads for a single to long leg
more swing from Southee. Bell overcompenstes for it as he defends. It runs off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
a touch overpitched this time, and he is driven straight of mid-off for two
looks for the bouncer, loses his line, and is wided down leg
nice swing back towards off and middle. The length is slightly short of what you can drive. Defended respectfully
halftracker. Don't think Southee or McCullum will like this. Not quite a bouncer. Just a short ball that sits up. Pulled away for the first boundary of the match
fuller, swinging back into the pads, hits him high, though

lovely shot. Not much wrong with the ball. Just short of a length, just outside off. He stays deep in the crease, and stays legside of the ball. Creates the length by staying back and uses the angle to create room, and crashes it for four through cover-point
full, swinging in this time, and he has just about kept it out
full-length dive by Guptill at sort of point-gully. Saves a run. That's four runs saved already
full, too straight, clipped away for a single
on a length, just outside off, not much swing, pushed away for a single
slightly short of a length, Bell stays back to cut it to third man

oh what a beaut. Beats the outside edge to hit the top of off stump. That is a peach. Angling in but swinging away. Lands around off. Bell has been in this mode where he is trying to stay beside the line to open up the off side. So he is not quite behind the line of this, and the ball swings to beat his bat. Off stump, bu-bye
lovely swing again. Full too. Ballance likes to hang back. Good ball first up. Just about manages to get an inside edge
lovely shot. This is in the slot. Full, swinging back in. Moeen stands tall and meets it with a straight bat. Beats mid-off to his left. No power. Just timing
Moeen gets width. Moeen loves width. He throws his arms at this length ball and clears short cover with ease

short and wide, and even though he has edged it over slip, this is not where you bowl to Moeen. If you put it there, modern batsman will throw their bats at it, and even if they get the edge, chances are they will fly over slip. Like this one has done
slightly fuller, closer to the stumps, pushed to point

big lbw shout but it isn't given by Rod Tucker. Ballance has moved too far across as Boult ones straight with the angle. McCullum has a chat with Boult, and reviews it. Just short of a length, pretty straight, Ballance has moved too far across and is caught in front. But it is bouncing over, as the replays suggest. NZ lose the review. It serves them right too because these milimetre calls is not what DRS is for
short of a length, outside off, opens the face to get a single
cut away to third man for one
full and straight, defended back to him
a touch too full, a touch too straight, clipped away towards deep square for a couple
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
bouncer at Moeen. You have to bowl there to Moeen. He is not comfortable there. Called a wide this time, though
on a length, no swing, defended in front of off

that's the one-two. Bowl a bouncer to those who don't like bouncers. Have them expecting another one and thus staying back. Slip in a full one. Take the edge or hit the the stumps. Southee has hit the off stump here. This has swung back in towards the base of the off stump and squeezes under it. Apart from staying back he has played woefully down the wrong line
full outswinger, starts outside off, left alone
full, this one swings in, defended solidly in front of middle and leg
loose shot. He is trying to cut what is not short enough. And then it moves away too. Beaten
full, just outside off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, angling in, defended
this one is outside off, and at a similar length. Left alone
full and swinging away, starts a touch wide, and is left alone
full, looking for the swing, but ends up too straight, and is wided
this one is straight too, and is picked off the toes
Boult is down on the pitch after losing his footing upon delivering. A bit of a pool dive on the pitch. He hasn't dived on to the danger area, though. The ball swings away a touch against the angle
this one just angles in, and is clipped away for a single
on a length, middle and leg, defended to mid-on
drops this length ball into the covers and charges through for a well-judged quick single
full, just outside off, Ballance stays back to defend

nearly gets Ballance. His back-foot play is recipe for disaster against Southee's swing. This one shapes in towards middle and leg, beats the inside edge because he is not forward to cover the movement. Just swinging too much, though. Oh hang on. The Hawkeye has it hitting the leg stump. New Zealand don't have a review left anyway. Not that NZ looked that interested in the appeal in the first place
good batting from Root. Another tip and run. This time to point
full and straight, middle and leg, defended back to him
defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
fuller, just holds its line as opposed to going through with the angle, gets an inside edge onto the pad. No short leg to swallow this
on a length, around off, defended from the crease
digs this one in short, Root pulls, not entirely convincingly, but gets a single to long leg
on a length, just outside off, angling in, defended with an open face
short of a length, outside off, some shape away, pushed to cover
short of a length again, runs it down to third man for one
bouncer this time, at 139ks, Ballance ducks it
wide down the leg side as he digs in short again
another wide down leg. Milne yet to hit his straps
and now he hits the right line. Middle and off, and then nipping back in towards middle and leg. Beats the bat, hits the pad, but it is bouncing over
that's a beauty. It seems this might swing back in. The trajectory in the air suggests that. Upon pitching, though, it seams away and beats the bat
tucks him up with a shortish delivery. Hurries him up too
full, a touch of swing, hits the inside half of the bat as he defends
tucked away off the hip for a single
swing there. Ballance is always going to vulnerable against swing bowling. He is hanging back in the crease, and just feels at a length ball in front of his body. It leaves him and beats him
too straight this time, and he has been placed into the leg side for a couple

short of a length, opens the face, no third man, this is racing away for four, but Milne - the fast bowler - gives it a massive chase and puts in a massive dive at the last moment. England take only the two runs. That's two more saved in the field. Six in all so far
Ballance hanging back to make decent balls look much better than they are. Just doesn't cover that little movement away, and is beaten
length ball outside off, holds its line, left alone
good shot. A length ball just outside off, Root moves forward into the shot, and drives it on the up. Between point and cover
full and straight, flicked past midwicket for one
short of a length, middle and leg, bunted to short midwicket
short of a length, holds its line around middle and leg. Defended to short midwicket
similar length but starts too straight, and is picked away for a single

Ballance is back, this is a shortish delivery, has some width too, and is there to be hit. But the ball just doesn't come on. Ballance has to wait. He tries to check the shot, but because his feet haven't moved he is not close to the line of the ball. He ends up toe-ending this softly. A simple catch to short cover. Boult gets a seventh over, and he has struck first ball
full and swing away, left alone
oh ho ho. Nearly works that plan. This is a big swinging delivery. Morgan thinks he can play this to leg, but the ball swings and opens him up. The leading edge doesn't carry to short cover-point
nearly bowled him. Full and just outside off, and he has played down the wrong line
length ball outside off, doesn't do anything. Left alone
this one is straight and at the stumps. Defended to mid-on
short of a length with the start, punched to leg but not past Guptill at midwicket. That's seven runs saved in the field
punched past point for one this time

Vettori is flat again, and Morgan is nearly run out. Very anxious to get off the mark. Played straight to short third. They want the one, but it is not on. Root starts off and then sends him back. He makes it in time, though
finally off the mark. Vettori stays shortish and wide. Cut away for a single
full this time, pushed to long-off for one
a reverse swing already. Vettori is accurate. Pitches middle and off, beats him, but hasn't turned back to draw a big lbw shout
length ball, off, not swinging, defended with an open face
that's seven runs saved in the field. He has run this off the face towards third man, but Williamson flies at gully to save one run
wide length ball, driven square, Vettori has to do some work to get around from third man and keep this one in  with a late dive
on a length, outside off, runs this off the outside half of the bat into the vacant third-man region

McCullum has saved at least two more here. I am counting it at nine. Pushed with a straight bat. Looks like an easy two towards long-off because the mid-off is back and there is no one back. Except that at the last moment McCullum comes flying in. No run
widish length ball, an driven to deep cover for one
flighted, middle and off, pushed down to long-off for a single
moves across a little to defend a length ball in front of off
slower through the air, driven to long-on for one
worked to leg for a couple
flighted outside off, defended
flatter delivery, looks to cut it, can't beat Taylor at backward point. There is a fumble but that doesn't cost them a run
full and straight, defended to mid-off
tight leave but a good leave. Short of a length, middle and off, angling away. So he has left it on bounce. And it bounces just over the off stump. That's bowled at 141ks
on a length, starts outside off, angles further away, left alone
short of a length, pitches middle and leg, angles towards off, defended
short of a length, just outside off, defended
angling across him but pitched a little further up. Left alone
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
flighted around middle and leg, defended back to Vettori
tossed up again, pushed to long-off for a single this time
shimmies down a touch, Vettori slows it down a touch, Morgan has to wait, and he plays a defensive shot
quicker this time, played back to Morgan
quick, on the pads, but Morgan plays it straight to short fine leg
full, wide and quick. Root goes for the drive, but is late into it. This is bowled at 145ks
short of a length, outside off, nicely played between the slip and gully for a couple. Third man is too square to keep this down to one
fuller, outside off, pushed to mid-off
top-edged for four. Bouncer at 142ks. He is late into the hook. Fine top edge. No fielder there
short of a length, outside off, punched to square third man for one
short of a length, around off, rises a touch, defended to point
flat, shortish, played with an open face to point
worked away for an easy single
flat, cut away for a single
make it 11 runs saved at McCullum flies at short cover and fields this behind his body
gets the single this time
makes room to take this from outside leg, punches it for a single to deep point
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
crunchy drive, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to third man for one
pulled away to long leg for one

no mid-on in place. Full and straight. Pushed through that gap. McCullum puts in another big chase, but I won't count this as one saved. Other fielders would have managed this too. George Binoy differs vehemently. He has rushed from mid-off, GB says. Let's make it 12 runs saved then
full fast and just outside off, defended to cover
and he begins with a wide down the leg side. Angling too far down
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
runs off the thick outside edge for a single as he pushes at a wide length ball
short of a length, wide, moves away, defeats Morgan's cut. Draws a bottom edge
another bottom edge on the cut. This is not short enough. He is under pressure to manufacture something
full and swinging away, he moves into the drive, and gets four for it. Not that bad a ball but the field for Morgan is more square and behind
full and straight, worked away for a single to deep midwicket
Mrogan makes room again and is beaten by a floater outside off
length ball, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
tossed up outside off, defended back to him
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
flat and quick, not much turn, he stays back, there is some excitement around the lbw, but the bat comes down in time
played wide of mid-on but not wide enough of the lightning Boult who keeps them down to one
angling in from round the wicket, too straight, and concedes a leg-bye
length ball, slight shape away, defended from the crease
angling in this time, and he has conceded a leg-bye again
this one angles in from outside off, defended from the crease
another leg-bye as this one beats the inside edge with movement back in. This could be one of the most expensive maiden overs
no it won't be a maiden. Morgan cuts this shortish delivery to deepish point for a single
flighted around off, slow through the air, defended back to him
down the wicket, looks like he is getting a single to long-on, but McCullum flies in to make it 13 runs saved
worked away off the pads for a single
flat and outside off, driven to deep cover for one
tossed up on off, driven straight to mid-off

Milne you beauty. Fast bowlers are not supposed to make impossible saves and take flying catches in the outfield. But Milne does. Morgan looks to drive hard at this, but the ball doesn't quite come on. He is early into the shot but is quite forceful, which means this goes in the air and travels a long way. The trouble is, it seems it straight enough of long-on. Milne, though, has judged it to perfection and puts in the last-second dive. Full length mind you. Almost ala McGrath at Adelaide Oval
and on cue it produces an appeal. He bowls a full swinging delivery that passes the bat at the same time as it hits the ground

what captaincy, what bowling. McCullum calls his strike bowler. Look, get me a wicket. Southee bowls one wide outswinger. That draws an appeal. And now he bowls an outswinging yorker that beats the outside edge of the new batsman and pings back the off stump. What a joy to watch the aggressive approach and the execution thereof by New Zealand
he goes for the outswinging yorker again but ends up bowling a fullie. Defended to short midwicket
bouncer now. Left alone
lovely dipping outswinger. This one drops on him, Buttler realises at the last moment he is not close enough to the pitch of the ball. Beats him with the swing
oh a touch too straight, and he has placed it through that vacant midwicket region

appeal for leg-before because Vettori is accurate and this doesn't turn. Bat first is the first instinct, but it is pad first, and New Zealand don't have a review left. A review would have returned umpire's call on the bounce on this one
driven to long-off for one
inside half of the bat as this is full and doesn't turn
tossed up outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
saws his charge and fires one in flat. Off the pad it goes to short fine
stays back to defend a flat delivery

lovely outswing bowling. Southee has a four-for. This is on a length, not too wide, you can't keep leaving them alone all day long in ODIs. Buttler pushes at it, Southee gets enough movement away to take the edge and England are six down
nearly another. Full outswinging yorker. Woakes is a dead duck sitting in the crease, but the bat comes down just in time to take the outside edge to third man
inswinger this time, concedes a leg-bye to Root

Southee. Unplayable Southee. Has a Michelle now. Four of them have been bowled to outswingers that have hit the off stump. That's beautiful. Outswingers hitting the top of off. Too good for a No. 8. Woakes' only mistake here is, he is not forward. Southee loves it. Gives him the space to let this outswinger drop and then move past the outside edge to hit the top of off. Nothing wrong in the pitch here. Just high-quality swing bowling and aggressive captaincy
swinging and full. Outside off. Steered away to third man
too straight this outswinger is, and he has picked away for a single
length ball, outside off, runs it down to third man
full and just outside off. Beats him with the yorker. Misses the off stump
on a length, angling in, played with an open face to point
full and straight, swinging back in, beats the inside edge, but it is headed down leg
Broad seems to have lost all confidence as a batsman. He is just not fancying getting behind the line of them. He has moved away from a straight length ball. Lucky that it has bounced over the stumps
bunted into the leg side for one
swinging into the pads, played to square leg
a wild swing of the bat after backing away, but that is better than backing away and doing nothing. The edge is healthy enough to defeat the aggressive field and carry over mid-on
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-off

Southee has six. Broad needs talking to. Ordinary attitude to batting. Running away and hoping for the best. He has moved away from leg, and just put his bat there. The leading edge to the full ball carried to mid-off where Vettori takes a two-hander to his left
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
another full outswinger, draws a soft leading edge towards cover
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
drops this in short, Finn sways away from it although this is not threatening him
short of a length, into the pads, defended
they think of an lbw appeal as this beats the inside edge but it is going down with the angle
full and outside off. Trying to suck him into a drive. Finn doesn't oblige
full and straight. Defended off the inside half of the bat. A maiden
driven past point for one. He won't mind that Finn is on strike now
goes for the inswinger, pretty straight, defended to midwicket

Seven for Southee. This is lovely stuff. Just floats in an outswinger outside off, Finn follows it, edges it to Taylor at first slip. Best figures for a NZer in a WC match. Root is left stranded, but he really should have protected Finn and not taken the single first ball
full, swinging in, aimed at off, gets the big inside edge for a single

driven away square, first misfield by NZ. Guptill at point. That concedes the single. Are NZ being cheeky? They know Root is taking every single on offer. Gives Southee the chance to take the best-ever figures in a WC match
full and wide, swinging in a touch, left alone by Anderson
finally intent from Root. Short, widish, he rocks back to cut it away for four

Milne and Root have denied Southee a shot at best-ever figures in a WC match. Milne is short of a length again, Root looks to pull, it gets a bit big, takes the top edge, and settled with Vettori at fine leg
